title: New North Church, Edinburgh
author: Livingston, Josiah.
snippet: We lived in Buccleuch Place. Our route to church was a lane calledWindmill Lane, which had many stables in it; thislane is bisected by a cross street called WindmillStreet, at the eastern end whereof there is a junctionof several streets, of which the narrowest and dingiestis the Potterrow. At the top of the Potterrow is alane at the back of the College, which led to anotherlane called the Horse Wynd, which descended to theCowgate.
